name: Surfing the Waves in New Zealand Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who stars as Jane March on "The Blue Rose?"
questions.explanation:
Antonia Prebble.

	All four actresses appeared on the show. The show, about an office temp that took a job in a big city law firm, ran for just 13 episodes before being cancelled in 2013.

questions.text: In "The Kids from Owl," a children's show that aired in New Zealand in the 1980s, what did OWL stand for?
questions.explanation:
Organisation for World Liberty.

	OWL was a government organization that used children with disabilities as its operatives to save the world.  The OWL operatives of course always bested the evil forces of SLIME or the Southern Latitude's International Movement for Evil.

questions.text: Jono Kenyan plays Dave, a 24-year-old bartender in which show?
questions.explanation:
"Step Dave".

	Titular character Dave meets the woman of his dreams, but unfortunately for the young and carefree bachelor she has three children. That's how he became "Step Dave."

questions.text: Hilariously named, "Shark in the Park" is a show about what?
questions.explanation:
Police procedural.

	The show follows a group of police officers from the Wellington station as they live both their professional and private lives. It was for three non-contiguous seasons.

questions.text: In "The Almighty Johnsons" Axl turns of age and finds out he is the reincarnated version of what Norse god?
questions.explanation:
Odin.

	Ironically as the youngest in the family, Axl is the most powerful of all the gods. He finds out that he is the second coming of Odin, and must set out on a quest to find the reincarnated Frigg before the entire world comes crashing down.

questions.text: The game show "7 Days" was developed and first started airing in what year?
questions.explanation:
2009.

	The show is a remake of the British game show "Mock the Week," but with added twists and turns for the New Zealand audience.  The teams on each episode were made up of three stand-up comedians each, who were tasked with taking headlines from a week's worth of news and turning them into bits.

questions.text: The show "Super City" is a retelling of the Superman mythos, but from the point of view of if had landed in New Zealand instead of the United States.
questions.explanation:
False.

	The series actually follows female protagonist Madeleine Sami as she takes on five separate roles in the big city. No super heroes involved at all.

questions.text: What animation studio produced "The Adventures of Massey Ferguson"?
questions.explanation:
Flux Animation.

	Flux Animation made the show for young children. The show centered around a farm in the fictional city of Kumara Cove.

questions.text: "Sticky TV" was originally hosted by whom?
questions.explanation:
Paul Delamere.

	Delamere was the host from 2002 to 2003. Paki and Cooper hosted the show in 2014 and Drew Neemia left the program in 2009.

questions.text: Shortland Street, which began airing in 1992 is what genre of show?
questions.explanation:
Soap opera.

	The show premiered on New Zealand televisions in May of 1992. It is primarily set in a hospital and has a frequent rotation of characters to focus on.
